STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
February 16, 2024
Sally Smith
Ennis Center For Children - Port Huron
222 Huron Ave.
Port Huron, MI. 48060-3822
RE: License#: CB740315326
Dear Ms. Smith:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 02/13/2024. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective
action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Jessica VandenHeuvel area manager at 616-204-6992.
Sincerely,
Pinkey Brown, Licensing Consultant
Pontiac, MI 48342
brownp2@michigan.gov
(248) 860-3012
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
RENEWAL INSPECTION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
License #: CB740315326
Licensee Group Organization: Ennis Center for Children Inc

Chief Administrator: Sally Smith
Name of Agency: Ennis Center For Children- Port Huron

Port Huron, MI. 48060-3822

Homes for License, Supervise Independent
Living, Place Children in Foster Home,
Evaluate Applicants For Adoption

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
FOM POLICY 722-08D TREATMENT PLANS – AGREEMENT AND
SIGNATURES
Once completed and approved the caseworker must
obtain signatures from the following individuals, as
applicable:
Caseworker, Supervisor, second line supervisor, when
siblings in care are place apart, parents who are a
member of a participating household. Youth ages 14
and older. Foster parents, relative caregivers, and
unrelated court -ordered caregivers. Parents/legal
guardians, youth, and caregivers must check yes or no
for the following when signing the treatment plan: I
have participated in the Development of the Case
service plan and Parent Agency Treatment Plan.
3 of 7 open foster care files and 7 service plans were reviewed, (4 of 7 PATPs)
were either missing PATP signatures, signatures not obtained within 30 days of
the updated service plans and yes or no was not checked indicating participation
of the updated service plan.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
05/19/2023 Interim, CAP Approved 05/31/2023.

IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas.
• Technical Assistance was not needed or provided.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas.
• Consultation was not needed or provided.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were two substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
SI#2023C0000298 was generated on 1/25/24 for behavior management. The
caregiver was found in noncompliance with rules 400.9201 (1, j) 9403 (d), and 9404
(3). The caregiver was placed on central registry and their license was revoked.
SI#2023C0000357 was generated on 02/10/23 for behavior management. The
caregivers were found in noncompliance with rules 400. 9201(e) (3), 9403 (1), (c).
The caregiver’s license was revoked.
SI#2022C0631026 was generated on 7/5/22 for corporal punishment. The
caregivers were found in noncompliance with rules 400. 9404 (3), 9201 (j), and
9417 (1). The caregivers were placed on central registry and their license was
revoked
There one incident of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period
As indicated above, SI#2022C0631026 was generated on 7/5/22 for corporal
punishment. The caregivers were found in noncompliance with rules 400. 9404
(3), 9201 (j), and 9417 (1). The caregivers were placed on central registry and their
license was revoked.

Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 2 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows:
Special Investigation #2023C0000585 was generated on 07/03/2023 and the CAP
was approved on 08/24/23. The agency was found in noncompliance with the rule
400.12327 (5) and Public Act 116, 722.120 (10) (3). The agency has made
progress with this CAP and there has been no repeat violations.
The agency Interim inspection was completed on 05/20/23 and the CAP was
completed on 05/31/2023. The agency was found in noncompliance with rule
400.12418 (2) (b) and DHHS policies 722.08D and 801-3. The agency has one
repeat violation during this licensing period with DHHS policy 722.08D. Overall,
the agency is making efforts to improve this noncompliance.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment was reviewed and discussed with the agency
director on 02/07/2024. The director reported barriers and systemic factors that
impacted rules, ISEP, policy and contract compliance which included high staff
turnover this past year within all program components. She said the hardest hit
program was the foster care staff. The Chief Administrator (CA) reported each
staff turnover caused case management issues regarding continuity of care and
timeliness of policy requirements being completed as workers were learning their
new cases, policy, procedures and supervisors having a high number of new staff
to train. The CA reported the corrective action plan brought attention to areas that
needed oversight and improvement. She reported the CAP enforced supervisors
and director accountability to ensure staff are adhering to rules and policy
standards.
Financial Overview
The agency annual audit by an independent certified public accountant and their
annual budget were reviewed. No concerns were noted.
Staff Interviews
Staff interviewed reported they enjoyed working at the agency. The staff reported
they are supported by their supervisors and coworkers. Staff reported feeling
overwhelmed at the high staff turnover. The staff stated working a couple of days
mobile would help reduce their stress level.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The building has adequate space to provide the required services and the record
maintenance were stored securely.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There was one safety alert identified.

Concern:
Safety Alert dated 01/18/2024. The home did not have a smoke
detector in the basement. There was no rescue equipment observed for the
swimming pool and no alarm on the front rear door that leads or allow access to the
pool. The hot tub does not have a safety cover that could be locked.
Resolution:
A special evaluation was opened on the home 01/18/2024 as a result of the safety
alert. A home visit was held, and the worker observed the smoke detector in place
and working in the basement, pool rescue pole, the hot tub had a safety cover with a
lock and alarms were installed on both front and garage doors. Photos of
completion are attached to the safety alert.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
02/16/2024
Pinkey Brown Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
February 16, 2024
Jessica VandenHeuvel Date
Area Manager
